meanings.definition: To channel or direct something through a funnel.
meanings.sent1: She was funnelling the sand into the bottle.
meanings.sent2: The chef was funnelling the cake batter into the pan.
meanings.sent3: The kids had a funnelling race with water and straws.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were funnelling towards a solution.
meanings.sent5: The tornado was funnelling debris into the sky.

meanings.definition: To move or flow in a narrow stream.
meanings.sent1: The ants were funnelling out of the anthill.
meanings.sent2: The water was funnelling down the drain.
meanings.sent3: The students were funnelling into the classroom after recess.
meanings.sent4: The cars were funnelling through the narrow tunnel.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight was funnelling through the trees.

meanings.definition: To concentrate or focus on a particular direction or goal.
meanings.sent1: She was funnelling all her energy into the project.
meanings.sent2: The team was funnelling their efforts towards winning the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat was funnelling its attention on the moving toy.
meanings.sent4: His passion was funnelling into his music.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight was funnelling onto the main performer.
